bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PIERLUISI:H.R. 1203.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The constitutional authority on which this bill rests isthe power of the Congress to enact copyright law, asenumerated in Article I, Section 8, Clause 8 of the UnitedStates Constitution, and to regulate commerce among theseveral states, as enumerated in Article I, Section 8, Clause3 of the Constitution.[Page H1987]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

item.fullName: Resident Commissioner Pierluisi, Pedro R. [D-PR-At Large]
Del. Faleomavaega, Eni F. H. [D-AS-At Large]
Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

summary.text:
Fairness for the U.S. Territories Under STELA Act - Amends the Satellite Television Extension and Localism Act of 2010 (STELA) to include the U.S. territories of American Samoa, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands as separate designated market areas for the purposes of specified statutory copyright licensing provisions related to low power television stations.

Subjects to such licensing requirements certain secondary transmissions of a performance or display of a work embodied in a primary transmission of a television broadcast station if the secondary transmission is of the primary transmission of a television broadcast station that: (1) qualifies as a specialty station pursuant to Federal Communications Commission (FCC) rules and regulations in effect on June 24, 1981; and (2) is licensed as a low power television station located in such territories, to a subscriber residing within the same territory as the station originating the transmission.

bill.title: Fairness for the U.S. Territories Under STELA Act

item.title: Fairness for the U.S. Territories Under STELA Act
To amend title 17, United States Code, to include the United States territories in the application of certain statutory copyright licenses related to low power television stations.
Fairness for the U.S. Territories Under STELA Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
